fields.value: Census of Population and Housing, 1970 [United States]:  Master Enumeration District (MED) Lists

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection contains the MEDList file, the geographic reference file for the 1970 Census containing records for states, counties, minor civil divisions (MCD) or census county divisions (CCD)s, place segments, enumeration districts, and block groups. Items include state code, county code, MCD/CCD code, place code, place type, standard consolidated area code, standard metropolitan statistical area (SMSA) code, urbanized area code, tracted area code, state economic area code, economic subregion code, central business district code, area name, tract code, block group code, enumeration district code, urban/rural classification, ward code, congressional district code, housing count, and population count.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR I.A.1.b. Census Enumerations: Historical and Contemporary Population Characteristics, United States, Decennial Censuses, 1970 Census

fields.value: Version Date: 2009-06-19Version Text: 2009-06-19Version Date: 2009-06-19Version Text: 2009-06-19 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SAS, SPSS, and Stata setups have been added to this data collection.;Version Date: 2001-05-09Version Text: 2001-05-09 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Blank records at the end of the data file have been removed, and the codebook is now available as a PDF file.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The codebook, which comprises National Data Use and Access Laboratories (DUALabs) Technical Document No. GT-1 and Part 1 of the 1970 Census Users' Guide, is provided by ICPSR as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
